snippet: Britain, France and Germany failed on Friday to reach an agreement on the proposed $45 billion merger, but officials dismissed reports that the talks were on the verge of collapse.
abstract: Britain, France and Germany fail to reach an agreement on a proposed $45 billion merger between EADS and BAE Systems, but officials dismiss reports that the talks are on the verge of collapse.

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin, and Mark Scott from London.

lead_paragraph: Britain, France and Germany failed on Friday to reach an agreement on the proposed $45 billion merger, but officials dismissed reports that the talks were on the verge of collapse.

headline.seo: EADS and BAE Systems Merger Talks Hit Rough Patch
headline.main: Trouble in Talks to Merge EADS and BAE Systems
headline.print_headline: Trouble in Talks to Merge EADS and BAE Systems

keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co
